edu.stanford.cs.pptx.code

Class PPHeapStackViewer

  • Object
    • edu.stanford.cs.pptx.code.PPHeapStackViewer

  • public class PPHeapStackViewer
extends Object
    This class manages a heap-stack diagram.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PPHeapStackViewer(PPCodeTraceSlide slide, double x, double y)
      Creates a new single-column heap-stack viewer at the specified point.
      PPHeapStackViewer(PPCodeTraceSlide slide, double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Creates a new heap-stack viewer with the specified bounds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PPHeapStackViewer

        public PPHeapStackViewer(PPCodeTraceSlide slide,
                         double x,
                         double y)
        Creates a new single-column heap-stack viewer at the specified point. The height extends from the specified y coordinate to the bottom of the slide.
        Parameters:
        slide - The PPCodeTraceSlide to which the viewer belongs
        x - The left edge of the stack region
        y - The top edge of the stack region

      • PPHeapStackViewer

        public PPHeapStackViewer(PPCodeTraceSlide slide,
                         double x,
                         double y,
                         double width,
                         double height)
        Creates a new heap-stack viewer with the specified bounds.
        Parameters:
        slide - The PPCodeTraceSlide to which the viewer belongs
        x - The left edge of the stack region
        y - The top edge of the stack region
        width - The width of the stack region
        height - The height of the stack region

      • setFont

        public void setFont(String str)
        Sets the font for the values in the stack. In this version of setFont, the font is expressed as a string in the form 
            "family-style-size"
        Parameters:
        str - A string representing the font

      • getAddressFont

        public Font getAddressFont()
        Gets the address font.
        Returns:
        The font used to display the addresses

      • setLabelOrientation

        public void setLabelOrientation(String str)
        Sets the format for the labels attached to the word. The parameter is a string consisting of the literal words "address" and "label" separated by a hyphen, if both appear. The field to the left of the hyphen appears on the left side of the variable box and the field to the right of the hyphen (or a field alone on the line) appears to right of the variable box.
        Parameters:
        str - The orientation string

      • getLabelOrientation

        public String getLabelOrientation()
        Gets the format for the labels attached to the word.
        Returns:
        The orientation string
